item.title: [C4D] Compositing
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Tico135:

In the first one is it just me or does the light/table seem to be crooked? Other then that they look great!

Didnt see your comment at first, but actually the picture was sideways

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Compositing
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Actually that’d be like the worst way to do this.

Best way possible would be to render out a channel for the diffuse and other channels for the objects depending on what kind they are. Then a shadow and an alpha pass. Alpha pass for the mask on the other channels and then the shadow pass on multiply blend mode. Ultimate control.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Compositing
item.dc:creator: @belbn belbn
item.description:
@belbn wrote:

Could you tell me the tutorial used for this?

I dont know what this is called google searching wise.

I mean I know you could just hit render and in photoshop magic eraser the blackness but is there a better way to do it

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Compositing
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:21, topic:236195”][quote author=Frell link=topic=311612.msg2486488#msg2486488 date=1223861767]

I think you should get into HDRI shooting. It could make a hellova difference.

The problem with that is i cant use a sky and also use a background at the same time. I think theres a way, but im not sure.
[/quote]

Eliminate the use of the background. Composite them in photoshop.[/quote]
In the tutorial i saw he used a sky but he made it so the background showed over the sky, ill have to review it tomorrow.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Compositing

I think you should get into HDRI shooting. It could make a hellova difference.
[/quote]
The problem with that is i cant use a sky and also use a background at the same time. I think theres a way, but im not sure.[/quote]

item.title: [C4D] Compositing
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:16, topic:236195”]Ok Frell. Let’s get this straight. When I first saw this thread I thought I had some competition now. I kinda got jealous. I think you’re doing a great job.

Are these all photos you took of your house? Did you use HDRI? That’s the only thing missing. I’m wondering how it looks this good without it. My favorite is the three on the couch. Get an HDRI of that room and lower the saturation and levels of the three things in photoshop and that shit would be ballin.[/quote]
I took all the pictures, and i usually take a picture of the direct opposite of the room and use it as an HDRI. Surprisingly most of them came out great without them.

And im glad you think im getting better, i dont always think i am but i always do when i take a look at my very first render:

Lol.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Compositing
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Ok Frell. Let’s get this straight. When I first saw this thread I thought I had some competition now. I kinda got jealous. I think you’re doing a great job.

Are these all photos you took of your house? Did you use HDRI? That’s the only thing missing. I’m wondering how it looks this good without it. My favorite is the three on the couch. Get an HDRI of that room and lower the saturation and levels of the three things in photoshop and that shit would be ballin.

Read full topic

item.description:

The one with the balls on your sister’s bed, you need to put something on the bed to make an impression. Then take a picture and shove the balls on. Does not look real with them sitting on top like that.

item.title: [C4D] Compositing
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:5, topic:236195”]DUDE, YOU HAVE A GOLF CART?

Oh and you have to add a bit of noise to the parts with C4D to make it blend in with the rest of the image better.[/quote]

yea, I would say either find someone on yearbook or something with one of those epically crisp cameras or just add some more noise into your render.

Read full topic
